quote: Modesty is not only an ornament, but also a guard to virtue.
Although modesty is natural to man, it is not natural to children. Modesty only begins with the knowledge of evil.
As blushing will sometimes make a whore pass for a virtuous woman, so modesty may make a fool seem a man of sense.
I have often wished I had time to cultivate modesty. But I am too busy thinking about myself.
Modesty and unselfishness - these are the virtues which men praise - and pass by.
Modesty is not only an ornament, but also a guard to virtue.
Although modesty is natural to man, it is not natural to children. Modesty only begins with the knowledge of evil.
As blushing will sometimes make a whore pass for a virtuous woman, so modesty may make a fool seem a man of sense.
I have often wished I had time to cultivate modesty. But I am too busy thinking about myself.
Modesty and unselfishness - these are the virtues which men praise - and pass by.
Modesty and unselfishness - these are the virtues which men praise - and pass by.
Modesty forbids what the law does not.
Modesty is a quality in a lover more praised by the women than liked.
Modesty is the chastity of merit, the virginity of noble souls.
Modesty is the color of virtue.
Modesty is the conscience of the body.
Modesty is the only sure bait when you angle for praise.
Modesty seldom resides in a breast that is not enriched with nobler virtues.
Nothing can atone for the lack of modesty; without which beauty is ungraceful and wit detestable.
Ornaments were invented by modesty.
Sincerity is not a spontaneous flower nor is modesty either.
So rare is the union of beauty with modesty.
The man who is ostentatious of his modesty is twin to the statue that wears a fig-leaf.
True modesty does not consist in an ignorance of our merits, but in a due estimate of them.
We must watch over our modesty in the presence of those who cannot understand its grounds.
We wound our modesty and make foul the clearness of our deservings, when of ourselves we publish them.
With people of limited ability modesty is merely honesty. But with those who possess great talent it is hypocrisy.
